cells.source:
# Github Issues Visualization

Track raicode issues and pull requests. Visualization shows performance metrics related to resolving issues, categorized by issue labels and milestones.

## Install data

Data is uploaded from local json files. See the [repository](https://github.com/RelationalAI/crhunt/tree/main/projects/github_issues) for tools to pull and format data.

/*
 * Load data, specifying repo name for each data type json_*
 * 
 * Note: We are not using parse_json directly because of some parse handling that is different atm.
 */
def repo = :raicode
def config:repos[:data] = json_repos_raicode
def config:labels[:data] = json_labels_raicode
def config:milestones[:data] = json_milestones_raicode
def config:users[:data] = json_users_raicode
def config:issues[:data] = json_issues_raicode

def insert[:json_repos] = repo, load_json[config:repos]
def insert[:json_labels] = repo, load_json[config:labels]
def insert[:json_milestones] = repo, load_json[config:milestones]
def insert[:json_users] = repo, load_json[config:users]
def insert[:json_issues] = repo, load_json[config:issues]

## Issue Tracking

Tracking raicode issues and pull requests.

### Priority: Impact of priority label on issue duration

How long are issues open? How does the issue priority impact how long it is open?

def priority_data:mean(lb,v) = label:duration:agg[mean][Issue](lb,v) and
	label:in:priority(lb,_)
def priority_data:label(lb,v) = label:in:priority(lb,v)

def config = vegalite_utils:data[priority_data]
def config = vegalite_utils:title["Issue Duration by Priority"]
def config:width = 500
def config:height = 400

def chart = vegalite:bar[:label, :mean, config]
def output = vegalite:plot[chart]
